By publishing, you agree to the Terms of Use, and to irrevocably release your contributions under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license.

By publishing, you agree to the Terms of Use, and to irrevocably release your contributions under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. Edits will be attributed to the IP address of your device. If you log in, you will have more privacy.
Edits will be attributed to the IP address of your device. If you log in, you will have more privacy.

Two-factor authentication required! Please login from the main screen, and enter the code from your 2FA token.
Email verification required! Please login from the main screen, and enter your email verification code.
Unable to re-login. Please go back to the main screen and log in manually.
You logged in with a temporary password. To finish logging in, please set your new password here.
This will log you out on all devices where you are currently logged in. Do you want to continue?
You have been logged out of Wikipedia. Would you like to log in again?

Vanishing is a last resort and should only be used when you wish to stop editing forever and also to hide as many of your past associations as possible.

Account deletion on Wikipedia is done by changing your account name to make it so others cannot recognize your contributions in a process called account vanishing. Vanishing does not guarantee complete anonymity or remove contributions to the projects.
Track what you\'ve been reading here.
Some articles in history may not be viewable while offline.
Search and read the free encyclopedia in your language
Password can\'t be the same as username
The password must be at least 8 characters
Create account with no email address?
Although the email address is optional, it is highly recommended, since an email is needed for account recovery if you ever lose your password.
Recommended since email is needed for account recovery.
The user name \"%s\" is not available. Please choose a different name.
Sorry, your IP address is currently blocked from creating new accounts.

Allow the app to send crash reports to a third-party service provider automatically so that we can review your crash and fix the bug faster and more easily.

This page has been fully protected.
This page has been protected to the following levels: %s

Keep track of what\'s happening to articles you are interested in. Tap the overflow menu and select Add to Watchlist to see changes to an article.
This app was translated by the volunteer translators at translatewiki.net.
Source code available on GitHub under the Apache 2.0 License. Unless otherwise specified, content is available under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike License.

The article has been opened in a background tab.
This may be an unconstructive edit. Are you sure you want to publish it?
You cannot publish this edit. Please go back and change it.

An automated filter has identified this edit as potentially unconstructive. It may contain one or more of the following:

· Typing in all caps
· Blanking articles or spamming
· Irrelevant external links or images
· Repeating characters

An automated filter has identified this edit as potentially unconstructive, or potential vandalism.

Thanks for your continued interest in editing article descriptions! To make additional edits, please log in to your Wikipedia account.
By changing the article description, I agree to the Terms of Use and to irrevocably release my contributions under the Creative Commons CC0 license.
usually begin with a lowercase letter
Try to keep descriptions short so users can understand the article\'s subject at a glance
The text must not end with punctuation.
Avoid starting with articles like “a” or “the”.
Start with a lowercase letter unless the first word is a proper noun.
Avoid starting with a lowercase letter.
The text appears to be in an unexpected language. The language should be %s.
Please verify your description is in %1$s. Feel free to ignore this warning if the description you\'ve written is in %2$s.
Enjoyed that? Help us add more.
You just made Wikipedia better for everyone
You can also edit articles within this app. Try fixing typos and small sentences by clicking on the ^1 icon next time

Ideally one line, between two to twelve words

Suggested edits is a new way to edit Wikipedia on Android. It helps you make small but vital contributions to Wikipedia.\nOur goal is to make editing easier and more accessible for everyone! Log in or join Wikipedia to get started.

Suggestions are machine generated and you will use your judgment to decide whether to accept or reject them.

Inspect the image and its associated information

Reading insights are based on your app languages in settings, and editing insights are limited to your primary app language. Insights leverage local data, with the exception of edits which are public.
Looks like you haven\'t made an edit this month. Extend free knowledge by editing topics that interest you.
Activity modules are turned off. Switch them on to see updates in this tab.
Start reading and editing to build your history
See how much time you\'ve spent reading and which articles or topics you\'ve explored over time.
Discover insights about your contributions and the reach of the knowledge you\'ve shared.
Explore stats for games, saved articles, and other activities that connect you more deeply with Wikipedia.
Choose which modules to display. All personal data stays private on your device and browsing history can be cleared at anytime.

Unsure where to get started with editing? Try Suggested Edits, a feature that creates opportunities to make small but vital contributions to Wikipedia. Alternatively, go directly to an article of interest and make a change using wikitext.
We know you tried your best, but one of the reviewers had a concern. Possible reasons your edit was reverted include:
your contribution didn\'t follow one of the guidelines.
your contribution looked like an experiment or vandalism.
If you are interested, see the edit history.
Permission to access storage on your device is required for offline browsing.
Permission to access storage on your device is required to use the Offline Library.

Dive down the Wikipedia rabbit hole with a constantly updating Explore feed.
Customize the feed to your interests – whether it’s learning about historical events On this day, or rolling the dice with Random.

You can make reading lists from articles you want to read later, even when you’re offline.
Login to your Wikipedia account to sync your reading lists. Join Wikipedia

We believe that you should not have to provide personal information to participate in the free knowledge movement. Usage data collected for this app is anonymous. Learn more about our privacy policy and terms of use.
We’ve found the following on your device:
You will only see content on the Explore feed and quick search filters for remaining Wikipedia languages.
Keep at least one Wikipedia language from which to search and read content.

Visible image label in the article
You can set how the media item appears on the page. This should be the thumbnail format to be consistent with other pages in almost all cases.
Templates are user-generated and may lack complete descriptions.

This template is missing TemplateData, and its parameters have been autogenerated. As a result the template and its parameters lack descriptions.

Talk pages are where people discuss how to make Wikipedia content the best it can be. Start by adding a new discussion topic to connect and collaborate with a community of Wikipedians.
Subject name already exists. Try a different one.
Thanks for using talk pages. Could you help us improve the app by participating in a survey?
Wikipedia - discussion on talk page topic \"%s\"
This is a talk page. Please respect the talk page guidelines, and remember to sign your posts by typing four tildes: ~~~~ when posting using wikitext.Wikipedia:Talk page guidelines

The subject and content text will not be saved.

Topic subscriptions will allow you to receive notifications about new comments in this topic. Please create an account or log into your Wikipedia account to subscribe to a topic.
\'Thanks\' are an easy way to show appreciation for an editor\’s work on Wikipedia. \'Thanks\' cannot be undone and are publicly viewable
The changes made in this revision are not publicly accessible.

Undoing means reverting the effects of one or more edits.

Share this reading list with others
Hi! I\'d like to share my Wikipedia reading list with you:

resources.string: Registered editors who have fewer than 10 edits of 4 days of activity.
Registered editors whose experience falls between \"Newcomers\" and \"Experienced users\".
Registered editors with more than 500 edits and 30 days of activity.
Highly accurate at finding almost all problem-free edits.
Finds most flawed or damaging edits but with lower accuracy.
With medium accuracy, finds as intermediate fraction of problem edits.
Very highly accurate at finding the most obviously flawed or damaging edits.
Highly accurate at finding almost all good-faith edits.
Finds most bad-faith edits but with a lower accuracy.
With medium accuracy, finds an intermediate fraction of bad-faith edits.
Very highly accurate at finding the most obvious bad-faith edits.
Try removing %s to see more edits
Are you sure you want to rollback?
Contribute to the oversight and approval of Wikipedia edits.
Enhance the quality of Wikipedia content by actively reviewing a feed of recent edits and providing guidance, quality control, and encouragement to other editors.
Offer feedback, monitor edits, and take actions on the diff screen
See a productive edit? Thank a user for their contribution.
Want to track article edits? Add to your Watchlist. View it under \'More\'.
Communicate with other editors. Save commonly used talk page messages or use a template.
Choose \'Undo\' to undo or rollback a potentially destructive edit.
Damage predicts if an edit causes damage to a wiki.
Intent predicts likelihood of an edit being saved in good-faith.
How can we improve the feature?
Tap on overflow menu to submit feedback anytime under \'Problem with feature\'.

Hi {{{username}}}, I want to let you know I\'ve reverted one or more of your [{{{diffLink}}}|recent contributions] because they do not seem constructive. If you think I made a mistake or have questions, you can leave a message on [[User talk:{{{senderUserName}}}|my talk page]]. Please note that continued vandalism may lead to restrictions.

Hi {{{username}}}, I am delighted that Wikipedia has caught your attention and that you have been interested in learning how to edit on it. The editing test you did worked; However, you should keep in mind that the goal of this project is to develop a reliable and complete encyclopedia that everyone can consult. Your edit affected the content, so it has been removed.\nIf you want to learn how to edit Wikipedia, the [[Wikipedia:Sandbox|sandbox]] is at your disposal. If your comments were specific to an article, the correct place is that article\'s talk page.

Hello {{{username}}}, some contributions you have made do not meet the neutrality required to comply with this Wikipedia\'s [[Wikipedia:NPOV|neutral point of view]] policy. For this reason, some content has been modified or removed. Please modify the paragraphs or sections that show a partial point of view, replacing them with a more neutral and objective text in line with what is expected in an encyclopedia.

Hello {{{username}}}, some contributions you have made are possibly machine translations, which is why they have been modified or marked with the template. If no improvements are made to the article, it may be deleted.\n\nIf, despite all this information, you still have any questions, feel free to leave a message on [[User talk:{{{senderUserName}}}|my talk page]]. Don\'t be discouraged by this little incident. Your contributions are very important to Wikipedia.

Hello {{{username}}}, I appreciate your collaboration on Wikipedia; However, I noticed you are in a [[Wikipedia:Conflict_of_interest|conflict of interest]]. A conflict of interest is the incompatibility between Wikipedia's objectives of neutrality and reliability and the particular objectives of certain editors, individuals, entities, or companies of any type.

All contributions in the main space are subject to the policies of content criteria of this Wikipedia ([[Wikipedia:What_Wikipedia_is_not|what Wikipedia is not]]), encyclopedic quality ([[Wikipedia:Verifiability|verifiability]] and [[Wikipedia:No_original_research|no original research]]), editorial method ([[Wikipedia:Neutral_point_of_view|neutral point of view]]), and legitimacy of content ([[Wikipedia:Copyrights|copyrights]]). All publishers are expected to abide by these policies when creating and evaluating content and to respect and assume good faith in the actions of other publishers to ensure that these policies are followed.

If you edit under a conflict of interest, you must apply the corresponding policy with special care; Otherwise, your user account could be considered private purpose and blocked. Feel free to reach out on my talk page if you have any questions.
Because you made multiple destructive edits, this will serve as your final warning. Should you vandalize Wikipedia again, you will be banned from editing.
Your recent edit appears to include copyrighted material without permission. Please ensure all content complies with this Wikipedia\'s [[Wikipedia:Copyrights|copyright]] policies to avoid removal.
Hi {{{username}}}, it appears you removed content from Wikipedia without leaving an edit summary. Please leave an edit summary whenever you add or remove content to Wikipedia.

Hi {{{username}}}, it appears you removed content without discussing it on the article talk page. Please note that Wikipedia is not censored, and content should not be removed because it is controversial. If you believe the information is inaccurate, please reach a consensus on the article talk page.
Use an example message below to customize, send and save to your messages.

Hello {{{username}}}. Your article is a great start! To make it even better, consider adding more references to reliable sources. This helps verify the information and improves the article\'s quality. Check out this Wikipedia\'s guidelines on [[Wikipedia:Reliable_sources|reliable sources]] for more details.

Activate your new app icon in Settings under App icon. Thank you for investing in the future of free knowledge. Your contributions as %1$s in %2$d are helping pave the way to a world of free information, and as a result you have unlocked a custom contributor icon for Wikipedia on your home screen.

We\'re glad Wikipedia was part of your %1$d! Unlock a special reward in your %2$d Year in Review by becoming a contributor—whether by editing Wikipedia or by donating from the app to the Wikimedia Foundation, the nonprofit behind it. If Wikipedia is useful to you, please consider donating to help sustain its future and keep it free, ad-free, trustworthy, and accessible to all. If you donated elsewhere, your support is deeply appreciated.

resources.string: For people around the world, Wikipedia is the first stop when answering a question, looking up information for school or work, or learning a new fact.
Create your Year in Review %d reading list?
Wikipedia Year in Review will create a reading list of the articles you spent the most time with in %1$d. Learn more
Made for %1$s. Articles you spent the most time with in %2$d.
Thank you for spending your year with Wikipedia.
We look forward to next year!

resources.string: Discover articles picked just for you
Your weekly reading list of Wikipedia articles, curated just for you.
To set up your recommended reading list later, go to Settings.
How should we build your recommended reading list?
Let me choose based on my interests
Choose for me based on my saved articles
Choose for me based on my reading history
We\'ve randomly selected a few articles for you.
Are you sure you want to randomize your selection?
This will clear your current selections and choose new articles at random.
Your daily reading list. Learn about new topics, picked just for you. Updates at midnight.
Your weekly reading list. Learn about new topics, picked just for you. Updates at the beginning of the week.
Your monthly reading list. Learn about new topics, picked just for you. Updates on the first of each month.
Discover will update with %1$d new articles each %2$s. Your recommendations are stored locally on your device.
Discover is off. Wikipedia won\'t recommend you articles to read.
If you turn off Discover, you\'ll stop receiving %s reading recommendations from Wikipedia.
Discover has been turned off. You can turn it back on anytime in settings.
If you adjust how Discover generates recommendations, your current recommendations will be replaced.
Your recommendations are now based on your interests.
Your recommendations are now based on your saved articles.
Your recommendations are now based on your reading history.
Wikipedia will not send you a notification when Discover is updated.
Notifications for Discover are turned off. You won\'t receive a notification when Discover is updated.
If you turn off notifications, you will no longer receive reminders when Discover is updated.
Your %s Discover reading list is ready.
Tap to see your latest recommendations.
When your Discover is updated, Wikipedia will send you a notification.
Discover is on. Wikipedia will recommend you articles to read.
Donation reminders can be modified anytime in Settings.
Your generosity helps keep Wikipedia thriving. Set up a donation reminder based on the number of articles you read.
Donations go to the Wikimedia Foundation and affiliates, proud hosts of Wikipedia and other free knowledge projects.
Thank you! We\'ll remind you to donate %1$s when you read %2$s while this experiment runs.
You set up a donation reminder on %1$s to give %3$s every %2$s you read. Ready to follow through on your pledge to support Wikipedia?
Donate a different amount with Google Pay
Donation reminders are on. Wikipedia will remind you to donate %1$s every %2$s you read while this experiment runs.
